sbol:Collection.dcterms:title: iGEM Parts Registry
sbol:Collection.dcterms:description: The iGEM Registry is a growing collection of genetic parts that can be mixed and matched to build synthetic biology devices and systems. As part of the synthetic biology community's efforts to make biology easier to engineer, it provides a source of genetic parts to iGEM teams and academic labs.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K587010
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: Tast -> Key sequence for low concentration mechanism
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
This sequence forms part of the group of pieces directed to the expression of a concentration mechanism developed by our team ITESM_MEXICO 2011. The activation of gene expression is achieved by transcribing a non coding RNA (taRNA) produced by a second promoter (the same promoter dependant on the concentration amount). This mRNA targets the crRNA (either crstRNA or crwkRNA) specifically. In this case this key targets the crstRNA. The tastRNA is designed to hybridize the stem-loop created by the crstRNA and unfolds the loop exposing the Ribosome Binding Site (RBS) and allowing translation. The interaction between tastRNA and crstRNA undergo a linear-loop interaction that exposes the RBS followed by the activation of the reporter protein (CFP).
It has the same mechanism of action proposed by the team of British Columbia of 2009. Part: BBa_K206031
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: David Ignacio Maycotte Cervantes
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: Isaacs, FJ, Dwyer, DJ, Ding, C, Pervouchine, DD, Cantor, CR, and Collins, JJ. Engineered riboregulators enable post-transcriptional control of gene expression. 2004. Nature Biotechnology 22(7):841-847.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: The sequence varies from the original biobrick of UBC in that this one is smaller. The loop was taken from the publication and the anti-sense design also was taken from the article of Isaacs.
